text: Eisaku Satō (27 March 1901 – 3 June 1975) was a Japanese politician and the 39th Prime Minister of Japan. He was first elected in December 1964. He was the first Prime Minister to have been born in the 20th century. Satō shared the Nobel Peace Prize with Seán MacBride in 1974. He received the award for representing the Japanese people's will for peace, and for signing the nuclear weapons Non-Proliferation Treaty in 1970. Satō was born in Tabuse in Yamaguchi Prefecture. He suffered a stroke on May 23, 1975 and fell into a deep coma. He died on 3 June 1975 a Tokyo hospital. == References == == Other websites == Category:1901 births Category:1975 deaths Category:Prime ministers of Japan Category:Nobel Peace Prize winners Category:Politicians from Yamaguchi Prefecture Category:Japanese Nobel Prize winners Category:University of Tokyo alumni Category:Liberal Democratic Party (Japan) politicians Category:Foreign ministers of Japan Category:Chief Cabinet Secretaries of Japan Category:Ministers of finance of Japan
title: Eisaku Satō
